title: Drawing, "Design for a Pitcher", 1701–50
medium: Graphite, pen and bistre on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Below is a round base; the shaft is an inverted calyx. The lower part of the body is a circular leaf calyx, above which rises a kind of inverse umbrella half opened. Each side has a framed panel with rinceau. The handle is at right; it is formed by scrolls.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Pitcher", 1701–50.
1701–50. Graphite, pen and bistre on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7411.
